intro: Dielsia stenostachya, commonly known as the narrow-staminal dielsia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in regions of Mexico and the Andes. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in spring. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, often with a slightly serrated edge. Dielsia stenostachya is primarily of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its unique floral structure and limited distribution.
